snippet: A review of nearly 22,000 companies found an association between gender diversity in executive positions and increased profitability.
abstract: Study by Peterson Institute for International Economics finds that companies with women in highest corporate offices are more likely to have increased profitability; report also reveals that many companies lack gender diversity, with almost 60 percent having no female board members, despite economic benefits.
lead_paragraph: A review of nearly 22,000 companies found an association between gender diversity in executive positions and increased profitability.

headline.main: Women in Company Leadership Tied to Stronger Profits, Study Says
headline.print_headline: Study Ties Female Leaders To Rise in Company Profits

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Peterson, Peter G, Institute for International Economics
